A single player game contains 9 questions of ascending difficulty. Each question has four possible answers, from which one is correct and three are wrong. Each correctly answered questions scores 10 points. If the answer was wrong or if the timelimit is over, you score 0 points.

A multi player game contains 9 questions. Before the question can be answered, two big buzzer buttons are displayed. The player who presses his buzzer first can answer the question. If he answered correct, he scores 20 points. If the answer was wrong, he score -10 points and the other player gets the chance to answer the question correctly, which gives him a score of 15 points.

To create a question, first enter the question text. After clicking on Generate Answers, the app generates some possible answers. With a click on the + symbol you can add your own answer. With a long click you can choose one answer as correct answer for the question. A short click selects an answer as wrong answer (distractor). The question can be created and submitted, if one correct and 3 wrong answers have been selected.

The Question Review gives you the possibility to review questions that have been created by other users. You can review the question by the criteria correctness, quality of the distractors (wrong answers), phrasing and difficulty.
The Highscore shows the most active players in question creation and reviewing. Each accepted answer scores 5 points, each submitted review scores 1 point.
In the menu you can select Ask Watson to get a direct answer to a natural language question.
Enter a natural language question and retrieve an answer. Show additional info via Menu->Show Scores.
